an4.174:1.1: Then Venerable Ananda went up to Venerable Mahakotthita, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.174:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Ananda sat down to one side, and said to Mahakotthita:
an4.174:2.1: “Reverend, when these six fields of contact have faded away and ceased with nothing left over, does something else exist?”
an4.174:6.1: “Does something else both still exist and no longer exist?”
an4.174:8.1: “Does something else neither still exist nor no longer exist?”
an4.174:10.2: you say ‘don’t put it like that’.
an4.174:10.9: … How then should we see the meaning of this statement?”
an4.174:11.1: “In saying that, ‘when the six fields of contact have faded away and ceased with nothing left over, something else exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:11.2: In saying that, ‘something else no longer exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:11.3: In saying that, ‘something else both still exists and no longer exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:11.4: In saying that, ‘something else neither still exists nor no longer exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:11.5: The scope of proliferation extends as far as the scope of the six fields of contact.
an4.174:11.6: The scope of the six fields of contact extends as far as the scope of proliferation.
an4.174:11.7: When the six fields of contact fade away and cease with nothing left over, proliferation stops and is stilled.”
